info.name: NGINX One v1.0
info.description: Manage your NGINX data plane instances, view security advisories (CVEs), and analyze NGINX configurations for issues and recommendations.

item.name: Retrieve a summary for all instances

request.description:
Retrieves a comprehensive summary for all NGINX instances, which includes details such as:
  * Certificate status and associations
  * Operating system details
  * Version of the NGINX Agent
  * Overall system status

response.name: Successfully retrieved the summary of NGINX instances.
Access denied.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description: Retrieves a list of the security advisories (CVEs) for an NGINX instance.

response.name: Successfully retrieved the list of security advisories (CVEs).
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

item.name: Retrieve an analysis report for an instance's configuration

request.description:
Analyzes the configuration of an NGINX instance and returns a detailed report.
The report includes insights, identified issues, and recommendations for optimizing and troubleshooting.

response.name: Successfully retrieved the NGINX configuration analysis for the specified instance.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

item.name: Generate an analysis report for the provided configuration

request.description: Returns an analysis report for the provided NGINX configuration. This report includes insights, identified issues, and recommendations for optimizing and troubleshooting. Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response. To publish the configuration, use the `PUT /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config` endpoint.

response.name: Successfully analyzed the provided NGINX configuration.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

item.name: Generate an analysis report for the provided modified configuration

request.description:
Analyzes the provided partial updates to an existing NGINX configuration and generates a report detailing potential issues along with optimization suggestions. 
This analysis accounts for additive updates made to `NginxConfig`. To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
This method compares the provided `config_version` with the current NGINX instance configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the `config_version` does not match due to an out-of-band update. 
Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. 
The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response.
To publish the configuration, use the `PATCH /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config` endpoint.

response.name: Successfully analyzed the provided NGINX configuration.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description:
Returns the configuration details for an NGINX instance, including: 
* Main configuration path
* Details about configuration files
* Details about auxiliary files
* Unique identifiers

response.name: Successfully retrieved the configuration details for the specified NGINX instance.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

item.name: Publish a configuration to an instance

exec: console.log("Publication id as set in the collection variables: " + hh);

request.description:
Publishes a new or updated NGINX configuration to the specified instance. 
If no existing configuration is found, a new one is created; otherwise, the current configuration is overwritten. 
Before publishing, use the `PUT /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config-report` endpoint to generate an analysis report for the provided configuration.

response.name: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /instances/{instanceObjectID}/publications.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

item.name: Apply partial updates to an instance's configuration

request.description:
Applies the specified partial updates to an existing NGINX configuration. 
This endpoint accepts additive updates to `NginxConfig`. 
To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
This method compares the provided config_version with the current NGINX instance configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the config_version does not match due to an out-of-band update. 
Before publishing, use the `PATCH /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config-report` endpoint to generate an analysis report for the modified configuration.

response.name: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /instances/{instanceObjectID}/publications.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description:
Returns the configuration details for an NGINX instance, including: 
* Main configuration path
* Details about configuration files
* Details about auxiliary files
* Unique identifiers

response.name: Successfully retrieved the configuration details for the specified NGINX instance and NGINX configuration.
Access denied.
The NGINX instance or NGINX configuration with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description: Returns a list of all configurations for a NGINX instance. Only the last 5 are kept on the NGINX One Console for a NGINX instance.

Access denied.
The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

request.description: Returns a specific publication for an NGINX instance. Only 5 previous entries of Publication are kept for each NGINX instance.

request.description:

request.description:
Retrieve the details for an NGINX cluster, including
* name

item.name: Parse a SSL certificate and validate

request.description:
Parses and validates a SSL certificate. This parses the provided PEM files, validates that the public certificates 
are in a valid X.509 format. An error response will be returned if the SSL certificate is not parsable.
If the provided key doesn't match with the leaf certificate, the metadata will still be parsed and displayed in the
response with 200 OK status, including a validation status that indicates the SSL certificate is unauthenticated.

response.name: Successfully parsed and validated the SSL certificate.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
Access denied.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description:
Retrieves the details for a SSL certificate, including
* Certificate Name
* Type of the SSL certificate, indicating whether it is managed or unmanaged by NGINX One Console
* Certificate issuer for the leaf certificate or the first certificate in a CA bundle
* Certificate subject for the leaf certificate or the first certificate in a CA bundle
* Combined validity period for multiple certificates
* Metadata for each certificate
* Metadata for private key if provided

response.name: Successfully retrieved the details of the SSL certificate.
Access denied.
The SSL certificate with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.
An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

request.description:
Updates both public certificates and key, or only updates either of them.
Additionally, this can be used to update a CA bundle.

response.name: Successfully updated the specified SSL certificate.
Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.
